August 24 at 8:33 AM ¬∑

The start of the new school year may look different this year, but there are still plenty of local kids riding the bus and walking to and from school! Please be patient as traffic patterns around the city settle into a new routine. During the first couple of weeks, streets around local campuses can be a lot more congested as parents adjust to dropping off and picking up students. Traffic in local neighborhoods can be a lot different too, as kids make their way to the bus stop and school buses make their morning and afternoon routes. And, of course, school zones are also in effect before and after school. So please be patient, slow down, and watch out for kids crossing the street.

post_text: Beth Bowers, a 7th-grader at Oak Run Middle School, recently collected food for the New Braunfels Food Bank & had a great showing of support. She is a Second Class Scout in the Scouting BSA. When asked about what motivated her, she said, "While watching the news, over the past few weeks they had been reporting how the area food banks were running low on food and in need of donations. So I decided to do a food drive in my neighborhood and collect as much as I could to help local families during this time. It was neat to see how a small gesture can make a big impact if we work together." Have other stories of NBISD students making an impact in our community? Send your ideas to news@nbisd.org.

post_text: Hey, Unicorns! Here is one way you can help in the evacuation efforts.
shared_text:
Humane Society of the New Braunfels Area, Inc.
August 25, 2017 at 10:10 AM ¬∑ New Braunfels, TX ¬∑

Update 8/28/17: We saw our evacuee friends and their pets off this morning around 7 as they move to more long-stay sanctuaries and shelters. Thank you to everyone who donated and volunteered to make it as easy on the animals and evacuees as possible.

HSNBA has been asked to assist evacuees at Churchhill Middle School who are coming to our area with their pets. We do not know yet how many animals are coming and what species but we are planning on setting up a temporary shelter at the Ag Barn on campus. Anyone with extra crates, towels, sheets, pet food bowls who would like to donate, please meet us at the Middle School and look for our HSNBA Adoption Van. We will be arriving about 1pm to meet our friends from the coast.

The New Braunfels Independent SchoolDistrict (NBISD) Facebook page is provided for two-way communication between NBISD and the community it serves. NBISD will update its social media page as often as possible to share information on the achievements of the students and staff as well as other relevant information.


All posting of comments on these pages is at the discretion of the page administrators.¬†The intent of these guidelines is not to keep any negative or critical information from being posted, but to protect the privacy and rights of NBISD staff and students. Naming specific employees or students in a negative way will not be allowed. The page administrators will review all postings to make sure they do not run afoul of the rules and follow the district‚Äôs guidelines.


NBISD welcomes your thoughts and comments and look forward to what you have to say. NBISD, however, will not leave comments that:


¬∑ Break the law or encourage others to do so. This includes respecting copyright and fair use laws. If you are talking about somebody else‚Äôs work, reference this or the person, and where possible include a link.
¬∑ ¬†Contain abusive or inappropriate language or statements. This includes remarks that are racist, homophobic, and sexist as well as those containing obscenities or are sexually explicit.
¬∑ ¬†Easily identify students and/or staff in defamatory,abusive, or generally negative terms.
¬∑ ¬†Do not show proper consideration for other‚Äôs privacy or are considered likely to offend or provoke others ‚Äì for example ‚Äì pick fights or goading others into inflammatory debates. BULLYING will NOT be tolerated!
¬∑ ¬†Are spam or unsolicited advertisements (i.e., reportedly posting the same comment or comments that are simply advertising/promoting a service or product).


The page administrators reserve the right to not post or to remove any comments at any time, for any reason. We hope that this will not be necessary.


These guidelines also follow the district‚Äôs ‚ÄúUse of Electronic Media‚Äù policies that can be found in BoardPolicy DH (LOCAL) at http://pol.tasb.org/Policy/Code/325?filter=DH and in the NBISD Employee Handbook.

Thank you for your support of New Braunfels ISD.
